snippet: The giant retailer announced a program to pay independent bookstores to sell its e-books and popular reading devices.
abstract: Amazon announces program to pay independent bookstores to sell its e-books and popular reading devices; booksellers will get small payment on each sale and commission on all e-books that reader buys in next two years; stores dismiss new program as Trojan horse aimed at further undermining their business.

byline.original: By DAVID STREITFELD and JULIE BOSMAN
byline.contributor: David Streitfeld reported from San Francisco and Julie Bosman from New York.

lead_paragraph: The giant retailer announced a program to pay independent bookstores to sell its e-books and popular reading devices.

headline.main: An Offer From Amazon to Its Most Bitter Rivals
headline.print_headline: An Offer From Amazon To Its Most Bitter Rivals
